CatDescriptText: Related article published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 18, 1959, pg. A10, reads: "Lovely Elizabeth Ann Terry Weds Dr. Rosegrain Collins of Chicago - One of the season's prettiest weddings was the one last Saturday, uniting lovely Elizabeth Ann Terry to Dr. Rosegrain Collins of Chicago, Ill.  The bride is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John W. Terry of 7320 Joshua St.  The groom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Ewing Batson of Nashville, Tenn.  The Rev. Augustus C. Sumpter officiated at the wedding which took place at St. James AME Church.  Given in marriage by her father, the bride was a vision of loveliness, wearing a gown of antique silk and alencon lace.  It was fashioned with a sweetheart neckline of the alencon lace and encrusted with bridal pearls, brief sleeves and an empire waist.  The princess line full bouffant skirt with alencon appliques ended in a graceful chapel sweep.  A queen's crown of pearlized orange blossoms held a veil of imported illusion.  She carried a bouquet of gladioli, lily of the valley and a white orchid.  Myrna Morton was maid of honor, and Betty Ann Davis matron of honor.  Bridesmaids were Ruth Ann Nales, Freda Blanton, Sharon Revels and Gladys Miller.  Bunnetta Kemp was a junior bridesmaid, and flower girls were Shelia Thomas and Donna Thompson.  James Collins was best man.  Ushers were Benjamin Hawkins, Richard Terry, Charles Hill, I. C. Batson and Samuel Johnson Jr.  A reception followed, after which the newlyweds left for a honeymoon in the Pocono Mountains.  The couple will make their home in Chicago.  The bride is a June graduated of Fisk University.  The groom is graduate of Meharry Medical College School of Dentistry."
TitMainTitle: Wedding party including bride Elizabeth Ann Terry Collins, possibly along with Myrna Morton, Betty Ann Davis, Ruth Ann Nales, Freda Blanton, Sharon Revels, Gladys Miller, Bunnetta Kemp, posed in St. James AME Church
